snippet: Mike McConnell, who once led the National Security Agency, is now the chief architect of Booz Allen’s cyberstrategy — and among the executives facing tough questions after a data leak.
abstract: Mike McConnell, former head of National Security Agency and now chief architect of Booz Allen Hamilton's cyberstrategy, is among executives facing tough questions after leak by contractor Edward J Snowden; results of inquiry could be disastrous for company that had one of best business plans in Washington, DC, with more than half of its annual revenue coming from military and intelligence agencies.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Mike McConnell, who once led the National Security Agency, is now the chief architect of Booz Allen’s cyberstrategy — and among the executives facing tough questions after a data leak.

headline.main: After Profits, Defense Contractor Faces the Pitfalls of Cybersecurity
headline.print_headline: After Profits, Defense Contractor Faces the Pitfalls of Cybersecurity
